评论详情: I mean for about $20 and being made out of plastic you would kind of expect a shoelace eyelet to break at some point, but not at 8 months of infrequent use. I don't feel like I got my $20 worth and honestly I really like the fit of these shoes, but the cheap plastic eyelets.....make em metal guys.
It's tight on the ankle, but perfect on the toes so you know.
These are not wide sneakers. will return. Very disappointed.

I am now a repeat customer. I am handicapped and drag my toes with every step. I can very easily wear out the toes of my shoes in a week or less. My last pair of these shoes lasted me several months. That is why I am buying another pair. And if the price stays competitive I will continue to buy them. Thanks for a good shoe at a good price.

评论概述: nice and wide BUT, it's a tight fit(presses down on the top of my feet
评论详情: i loosened the laces and stretched out the material. presses painfully on the top of my feet and toes. i am hoping the mesh will give after wearing for a bit, or a break-in period. otherwise, they are nice looking and seem durable. too soon to tell though
Great for $20
Las tallas no están bien calibradas, hice la devolucion y compre una talla más grande y aún así no me quedaron.

Size was not my size and after further investigation was that the size was European (duh!) I decided to gift them to someone who could wear them,...instead of sending them back for an exchange Choose Correctly on your size!

评论概述: Good shoes for a good price
评论详情: The shoes are exactly what they say they are, lightweight, and designed for zero-drop /barefoot. The insole is comfortable and the mesh of the shoe wraps around your foot. You can remove the insole for a true barefoot style shoe. I put baby powder in mine so you can see a little white coming out but that's because of the breathable mesh, not the shoe. They're great for 20 bucks, excellent running shoes, and I highly recommend

- True to size. I thought it ran small but then I loosened up the lacing and now it fits perfect. - Sleek, modern design. Doesn't look clowny or out of place at all. I got the gray patterned one. - Eyestay is made of cheap plastic. Looks cheap too - Mediocre/poor ground-feel. More sneaker-like rather than a minimalist shoe. Outsole is firm and insole is well-cushioned. Moderately comfortable. - Premium toe space. Toes splay freely. - Padded heel counter. What a G - Cemented sole most likely, and no side stitching so projected durability is not good.  Conclusion: Excellent for the price, pretty good shoe overall.
Ordered 11 Wide. Feel like a normal 10. Fit is not what Amazon "suggested". Either get bigger or get a different shoe. Comes in a clear bag rather in a shoe box. So, cheap already.
Just like wearing nothing on your feet except you are these are comfortable easy to put on and I hope don’t result in rubbing on my feet right now. They fit well.

I liked the idea of the wide toe box because I’d prefer to barefoot… this is not it though.  The toe box wasn’t very wide, the shoes were really hard and the material felt like you might end up with a blister.  I didn’t get past trying them on and walking through my living room before deciding to return.
Shoes are very comfortable and affordable.
The shoes fit well, comfortable, has great arch support, great material quality and is very flexible when walking. Great for outdoor activities
Seller shipped the shoes quickly, I received them within a few days of ordering them, they are very comfortable for around the house and yard
Comfortable and meets the

评论概述: Fit is smaller than the stated size
评论详情: I could not wear this shoe as it is just too small.

The shoes are just what I as looking for, simple flat-soled sneakers. After referring to the sizing guide, I was skeptical, as it indicated a size I haven't worn in decades. When the shoes arrived the sizing was spot-on. Trust their size guide.
I like the way they look, very stylish. My issue is that I have no arch and an over pronated foot. The shoe is just not made wide enough.

The shoes don't fit but in the weirdest way. I bought my usual size but they are about a size and a half to big, but at the same time they are to small for the hight of my foot. I have never seen shoes to small in that way before. The quality it about what I expected for the cheap price. Not terrible but also not good.
Smaller than I expected
Quick drying, nice fit. Durable.
My chiropractor recommended for me to use these shoes. They feel lightweight and the quality of the material is better than what I expected. I use them daily they help with my posture and alignment.
These shoes do not have a wide toe box! Tight, uncomfortable. Not good. Don't be mislead.

Very nice shoe for a "minimalist" or "barefoot" type of shoe. I'd describe it as a lightweight gum sole shoe. Sole is thicker than some other minimalist or barefoot shoes. It's easy to roll it up so not too thick but just right for what I was hoping to get in this shoe. I wear us 12, and this shoe in size 12 is just right. I'll add to this as I get some milage on them. I'll probably order another color just for the sake of variety. Oh, and in size 12, these don't look like bozo shoes. I know exactly what the other reviewers were talking about like toe box being disproportionately wide. Not the case with these.

I tried it for retraining my foot muscles after been using sneaker for work a long time, it feel so different. I notice more flexibility in my toes and foot. Quality is good, and value for money is a most.
First time wearing bare foot shoes!  Absolutely love them and will be getting 2 more pairs
Wide fit

I got these for my Husband and He loves the fit and style and he has flat feet he says they fit perfectly, he says they feel exactly like wearing No shoes at all, The brand name Barefoot is exactly right!
Affordable and fits exactly how I imagined. Wide box toe and flat, no extra cushion. I use these mainly for walks with the dog.

They are good shoes that are comfortable only after the break-in period which took only two days of normal use. They’re probably the most breathable shoe I’ve worn that isn’t a sandal. That’s all I have to say about them.

For people who want a pair of shoes for protection but still want the feel of walking barefoot these are ones. I understand and accept that these are not supposed to provide support or stability. These are meant to wear as if you were barefoot but with protection.

These barefoot shoes are a great choice for men who want to experience the natural feeling of walking or running. They have a zero drop sole that mimics the shape and movement of your feet. They also have a casual wide sneaker style that is comfortable and fashionable. They are made of breathable and flexible material that adapts to your foot shape. They are suitable for any occasion, such as sports, leisure, or work. They are a pair of shoes that can improve your posture, balance, and performance.

I had high hopes for these shoes, but they are not comfortable to wear. They are quite cheaply made in my opinion. They are very light and the shoe is true to size, but I stopped wearing them after the first day I had them.

Got these for my husband as his first zero drop barefoot shoe. After his first day of wearing them he said they are comfortable and the wide box on the toes feels like a great improvement from his typical shoes. He also has foot pain and, so far, these shoes are not causing him pain, for a change! The material feels durable, and not one that will sllow sand in like many mesh sneakers. The stitching looks good, the glue around the sole is neat and clean and they feel true to size. He's very happy with them!

They're a decent shoe. They're made decently well. Seem to have some stability to them. The issue I have with them even tho they are a barefoot minimalist shoe, there is very little support around the arch and heel. The toe box is nice and wide and allows your feet to splay correctly, there just is not a lot of stability to them. I used them in the gym and was no where near as sure footed as was in other barefoot style shoes.  I recommend them maybe for a shoe to wear at the beach or for an afternoon at the lake. but for anything that requires a foot to be stable, I would skip them.

This pair of shoes are the blackest lightest full coverage shoes that I have ever owned. The whole shoe is very flexible especially the soles. The inside has a nice cushion. I have a wide foot and finding shoes that will fit properly especially ones made in an Asian factory are almost impossible. I ordered wide shoes and they fit in width pretty well but could have been wider. The problem that I had was about two ours into wearing the shoes my heels began to hurt. The shoes were not slipping up and down my heels and I am not sure why the shoes rubbed my heals raw. I can not wear these shoes!
Fits true to size. Nice and lightweight. Material is breathable and washable. Comfortable and looks real nice.
Fits great and love the ease with which they can be put on. Versatile, basic look with an airy feel and a good sole.

评论概述: Almost feels like you're not wearing shoes!
评论详情: I was leary about how these shoes would be due to the minimalist design, but to my amazement they are quite comfortable. It almost feels like walking barefoot without feeling the stuff you step on. When you take them off and expect to drop down a little bit like you usually do with shoes because they add height but you don't it's a strange feeling.  The shoes were not rubbing and places they were not loose-fitting they were not too tight they are easy to get on and off. Issues are very easy to clean.  I ordered the shoes a size and a half larger than I usually wear expecting them to be smaller. However they are exactly a size and a half too big. So the size you order is going to be the size you get. However even though the shoe is too big for me I do not notice while wearing them or walking.  Very good shoes!

Runs about a half size too big... my heel seems like its slipping constantly... it doesnt cup my heel well because the little ridge inside the back is too low to fit into the dip in my top of my heel.  The sole isnt very comfortable to me - but that's very personal to each individual.  I have other minimalist shoes that are very comfortable so its not just that.  The tread is decent for everyday use, not for trail running.  These are town shoes.
Nice looking shoe though

This is a very lightweight sneaker, with a mostly fabric upper, and a rubberized sole.  The light weight makes them pretty comfortable to wear.  As advertised, these are normal fitting at the heel, with a wider toe box.  This makes them look a little like clown shoes, lol.  But it also helps with comfort if your toes tend to feel squished in normal fitting shoes.I walked about 1-1/2 miles in them today.  No issues, and the shoelaces stayed tied without having to double knot them.  I wish this were true for all sneakers.I am a little concerned about how these will hold up over time.  But I can’t knock them for something I “think” might be the case.  And at around $30 you really only need them to last for a reasonable timeframe.They are, as noted, quite lightweight, and with the fabric upper are probably not suited for cold weather wear.  Although it was high 40°s today during my walk and they were fine.

Minimalist is a great was to describe these shoes, as they are very basic. The vamp design is interesting, yet adds a certain tightness to the upper of the shoe. This is evident even while just slipping them on, you don't even need to tie the laces to feel some restrictiveness. The soles provide little to no arch support, so if you like a flat footed shoe, these are for you. They are wide in the toe section, so your digits will have extra comfort there. I ordered my normal shoe size, and they are true to fit as far as length goes. They slip on and off easily, but do not come off unexpectedly, or without assistance. The mesh material on top allows for breathing, so these shoes are geared better for warmer weather wear.

评论概述: They don’t look that great in person
评论详情: Thought I’d like the idea of an easy on an off shoe but these aren’t that great looking. They’re a minimalist shoe of course but I expected at least some comfort but being “minimalist” I guess it’s meant to feel like you’re barefoot. I feel that a pair of house slippers will offer better comfort than these do. Just not impressed with the product. I certainly wouldn’t wear them for outdoor activities like hiking. But some may like this type of footwear. I just never bought into the whole “minimalist “ idea. Might as well just go barefoot. The toe box is also too large in my opinion. Shoe doesn’t feel solid on the foot. Feels too loose. For me it’s a no go.

Shoes are truly flat and feel like you're walking at the same angle and level as you do when barefooted. Has a tiny hump in the middle just under the arch, if you want to get rid of that just simply take insole out. Shoes breath well and stay cool easy to tie but stretch well enough you can simply slip on and off. The outer rubber sole is flat and has triangular design on tread/traction. Simple, light breathable and comfortable aside from having your foot covered in fabric and little rubber it feels free and like your bare footed they weigh close to nothing when on. Love wearing them around the house. Shoes are well assembled with nice fabric and good stitchwork. Only issue I had was the way it came shrink wrapped with no box they ended up all tweaked and wrinkled with tips indented. I dislike that very much ruins the shoes shape.
